feature_1.description: Core values and ideologies held by the main characters.
feature_1.reasoning: Indiana Jones is driven by historical preservation and clashing with exploitative motives. In Titanic, Rose and Jack challenge societal norms with beliefs centered on love and personal integrity.

feature_2.description: The driving forces behind the characters' actions.
feature_2.reasoning: Indiana Jones seeks to protect the Ark, driven by academic and ethical motives. In Titanic, Jack and Rose are driven by love and a desire for freedom, contrasting with other characters' motives of control and survival.

feature_3.description: The relationships and interactions between characters.
feature_3.reasoning: Raiders of the Lost Ark showcases hero-villain dynamics, while Titanic explores complex social interactions influenced by class, romance, and disaster.

feature_4.description: The overall structure and progression of the story.
feature_4.reasoning: Both films follow classic adventure arcs with climactic ends. Raiders is an action-packed treasure hunt with supernatural elements, while Titanic combines romance with historical tragedy.
